title: `quarkus.otel.sdk.disabled` property doesn't follow naming standard to use `.enabled` suffix
body:
### Describe the bug

`quarkus.otel.sdk.disabled` property doesn't follow naming standard to use `.enabled` suffix

https://quarkus.io/guides/all-config#quarkus-opentelemetry_quarkus.otel.sdk.disabled

The common practice is to use `.enabled` suffix. There are 100+ cases with `.enabled` suffix when looking at https://quarkus.io/guides/all-config.

The only one with `.disabled` suffix is `quarkus.otel.sdk.disabled`. 

### Expected behavior

Use `.enabled` suffix

### Actual behavior

`quarkus.otel.sdk.disabled` property doesn't follow naming standard to use `.enabled` suffix

### How to Reproduce?

https://quarkus.io/guides/all-config#quarkus-opentelemetry_quarkus.otel.sdk.disabled

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

Quarkus 3.1.0.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
